result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Bernard Powell Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Bernard Powell Jr in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for James Bernard Powell Jr.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared in court on behalf of Amy E Spanczak for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State, but needs additional time to review with client. Court schedules the next court date for a status conference date, and sets 11/25/2022 deadline to file any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Signed. ORDER TO UNSEAL THE SEARCH WARRANTS
Received and Filed. MOTION TO UNSEAL SEARCH WARRANTS
Received and Filed. PROPOSED ORDER TO UNSEAL THE SEARCH WARRANTS

Defendant James Bernard Powell Jr appeared by video, in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle appeared by video for James Bernard Powell Jr.   Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant previously posted $10,000 cash. Court orders $1,000 cash remains and the rest is returned to the remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant James Bernard Powell in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Atty Steinle requesting an short adjournment for 8/18/22 at 1:30pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/15/2022@1pm

Adjustment Number: 22A 066031,
Payable Number: 1019671,
Receipt Number: 22RP028394,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8-15-2022 @1p
